adjective.description: Relating to or denoting a case (especially in Latin) of nouns and pronouns (and words in grammatical agreement with them) indicating separation or an agent, instrument, or location.
Relating to or subject to ablation through melting or evaporation.

noun.description: A word in the ablative case.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French ablative (feminine of ablatif), Latin ablativus, from ablat- taken away (see ablation).
